text: Melite or Melita (; Ancient Greek: Μελίτη) was the name of several characters in Greek mythology: * Melita, one of the Oceanids. She was one of the companions of Persephone along with her sisters when the daughter of Demeter was abducted by Hades.Homeric Hymn to Demeter, 419 * Melite, one of the Nereids.Homer. Iliad, 18.42Hesiod. Theogony, 247Pseudo-Apollodorus. Bibliotheca, 1.2.7ffHyginus. Fabulae, Preface *Melite, naiad daughter of the river god Aegaeus and mother of Hyllus by Heracles.Apollonius Rhodius. Argonautica, 4.538ff * Melite, one of the four daughters of Erasinus that became followers of Britomartis.Antoninus Liberalis. Metamorphosis, 40 *Melite, daughter of King Busiris of Egypt and possible sister of Amphidamas. She was the mother of Metus by Poseidon.Hyginus. Fabulae, 157 * Melite or Meta, daughter of Hoples and the first wife of Aegeus.Schol. ad Eurip. Med. 668.Pseudo-Apollodorus. Bibliotheca, 3.15.6. *Melite, eponym of a deme in Attica * Melite, one of the sacrificial victims of Minotaur == References == Category:Oceanids Category:Nereids Category:Children of Potamoi Category:Women in Greek mythology Category:Characters in Greek mythology
title: Melite (mythology)
